registry.title: PPP DLL Protocol Numbers
registry.note:
The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Data Link Layer contains a 16 bit Protocol field to identify the the encapsulated protocol. The Protocol field is consistent with the ISO 3309 (HDLC) extension mechanism for Address fields. All Protocols MUST be assigned such that the least significant bit of the most significant octet equals "0", and the least significant bit of the least significant octet equals "1".
It is recommended that values in the "02xx" to "1exx" and "xx01" to "xx1f" ranges not be assigned, as they are compression inefficient.

record.name: Fujitsu Link Backup and Load Balancing (LBLB)
RTP IPHC Compressed TCP No Delta
DCA Remote Lan Network Control Protocol (RLNCP)
single link compression in multilink control
EDPCP - Extreme Discovery Protocol Ctrl Prtcl

registry.title: PPP Link Control Protocol (LCP) and Internet Protocol Control Protocol (IPCP) Codes
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Link Control Protocol (LCP), the Compression Control Protocol (CCP), Internet Protocol Control Protocol (IPCP), and other control protocols, contain an 8 bit Code field which identifies the type of packet.

registry.title: PPP LCP Configuration Option Types
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Link Control Protocol (LCP) specifies a number of Configuration Options which are distinguished by an 8 bit Type field.

record.name: DCE-Identifier [Warning: option type in the RFC is incorrect.]

registry.title: PPP ECP Configuration Option Types
registry.note: A one octet field is used in the Encryption Control Protocol (ECP) to indicate the configuration option type .

registry.title: PPP CCP Configuration Option Types
registry.note:
A one octet field is used in the Compression Control Protocol (CCP) to indicate the configuration option type .
The unassigned values 4-15 are intended to be assigned to other freely available compression algorithms that have no license fees.

registry.title: PPP SDCP Configuration Options
registry.note:
A one octet field is used in the PPP Serial Data Transport Protocol (SDTP) to indicate the option type .
Note that Option Types 5-8 are specific to a single port and require port numbers in their format. Option Types 6-8 are specific to the HDLC-Synchronous Transport-Mode.

registry.title: PPP Authentication Algorithms
registry.note: A one octet field is used in the Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) to indicate which algorithm is in use .

registry.title: PPP LCP FCS-Alternatives
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Link Control Protocol (LCP) FCS-Alternatives Configuration Option contains an 8-bit Options field which identifies the FCS used. These are assigned as follows.

registry.title: PPP Multilink Endpoint Discriminator Class
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Link Control Protocol (LCP) Multilink Endpoint Discriminator Option includes a Class field which identifies the address class.

registry.title: PPP LCP Callback Operation Fields
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Link Control Protocol (LCP) Callback Configuration Option contains an 8-bit Operations field which identifies the format of the Message.

record.name: Location is determined during CBCP negotiation

registry.title: PPP ATCP Configuration Option Types
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Apple Talk Control Protocol (ATCP) specifies a number of Configuration Options which are distinguished by an 8 bit Type field.

registry.title: PPP OSINLCP Configuration Option Types
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) OSI Network Layer Control Protocol (OSINLCP) specifies a number of Configuration Options which are distinguished by an 8 bit Type field.

registry.title: PPP Banyan Vines Configuration Option Types
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Banyan Vines Control Protocol (BVCP) specifies a number of Configuration Options which are distinguished by an 8 bit Type field.

registry.title: PPP Bridging Configuration Option Types
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Bridging Control Protocol (BCP) specifies a number of Configuration Options which are distinguished by an 8 bit Type field.

registry.title: PPP Bridging MAC Types
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Bridging Control Protocol (BCP) contains an 8 bit MAC Type field which identifies the MAC encapsulated.

registry.title: PPP Bridging Spanning Tree
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Bridging Control Protocol (BCP) Spanning Tree Configuration Option contains an 8-bit Protocol field which identifies the spanning tree used. These are assigned as follows:

record.name: Null - no spanning tree protocol supported
IBM source route spanning tree protocol

registry.title: NetBIOS Frames Control Protocol (NBFCP) Configuration Options
registry.note:
NBFCP Configuration Options allow modifications to the standard characteristics of the network-layer protocol to be negotiated. If a Configuration Option is not included in a Configure-Request packet, the default value for that Configuration Option is assumed.
NBFCP uses the same Configuration Option format defined for LCP, with a separate set of Options.

registry.title: NBFCP Configuration Options - Name-Projection 'Added' field (value 1)
registry.note: The Name-Projection 'Added' field is not defined by IETF or allocated through IANA and thus no new values should be allocated.

record.name: Duplicate name in local name table.
Name not found or cannot specify "*" or null.
Name in use on remote NetBIOS.

registry.title: PPP EAP Request/Response Types
registry.note:
A one octet field is used in the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) to indicate the function and structure of EAP Request and Response packets .
This registry has been replaced. See the "Method Types" registry at for a current list of the assigned types.

registry.title: PPP Vendor Specific OUI Options
registry.note: PPP Vendor Extensions uses IEEE standard OUIs (Organizationally Unique Identifiers) to indicate vendor-specific features. See for details on contacting the IEEE. Vendors that desire to use their IEEE 802 OUI for PPP Vendor Extensions should register their OUI with IANA. Vendors that do not otherwise need an IEEE assigned OUI can request a PPP specific OUI from IANA out of the 'CF0000' range, which has both the "locally-assigned" and "broadcast/multicast" bits set to one. See for details.
registry.footnote: The duplicate assignment of CF0001 was inadvertent. As per Expert Donald Eastlake, this assignment has been moved to here from the ethernet-numbers registry.

registry.title: PPP IPCP Configuration Option Types
registry.note: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) Internet Protocol Control Protocol (IPCP) specifies a number of Configuration Options which are distinguished by an 8 bit Type field.

registry.title: PPP IPv6CP Configuration Options
registry.note: IPV6CP Configuration Options allow negotiation of desirable IPv6 parameters. IPV6CP uses the same Configuration Option format defined for LCP, with a separate set of Options. If a Configuration Option is not included in a Configure-Request packet, the default value for that Configuration Option is assumed.
